excerpt: Perched on a hilltop, this ancient Hindu temple honors Mansa Devi, the folk goddess of snakes.
detail_description: Maa Mansa Devi Temple, located in Haridwar, Uttarakhand, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Mansa Devi. Situated atop the Shivalik Hills, it is believed to be the abode of Goddess Mansa and holds great religious significance as one of the five auspicious pilgrimages in Haridwar.
name: Maa Mansa Devi Temple, Haridwar
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249403, India

detail_description: Har Ki Pauri is a must-see in Haridwar, known as one of the most emblematic sites of the Hindu religion. It is famous for hosting the Ganga Aarti at nightfall, drawing thousands of faithful who gather to lay flowers or light candles on the banks of the Ganges. The ghat is surrounded by various bakery and cake shops, offering a variety of sweet treats and baked goods for visitors to enjoy after experiencing this spiritual and cultural landmark.
name: Har Ki Pauri
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

excerpt: Historic Hindu temple accessible by cable car offering picturesque mountaintop views.
detail_description: Perched atop the Neel Parvat in the Shivalik Hills, Shri Maa Chandi Devi Temple is a historic Hindu pilgrimage site with a rich legacy. Built in 1929, it is believed to house an ancient idol of the goddess dating back to the 8th century. The temple attracts devotees year-round and is known as a Siddha Peetha, where worshippers seek fulfillment of their desires.
name: Shri Maa Chandi Devi Temple, Haridwar
address: W5MJ+G63, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249408, India

excerpt: This Hindu shrine dedicated to the goddess symbolizing India has a map of the undivided country.
detail_description: Bharat Mata Temple, located in Haridwar, is a distinctive multi-storey shrine inaugurated by the late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 1983. Standing at 180 feet tall with 8 floors, it celebrates India's unity in diversity. Each floor is dedicated to different themes such as Indian heroes, renowned women personalities, saints, and religious harmony. The temple features a unique map of undivided India made from diverse stones and offers mesmerizing views.
name: Bharat Mata Temple, Haridwar
address: X5MV+R23, भारत माता मंदिर सप्त ऋषि, रोड, Bhoopatwala, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249404, India

excerpt: Sacred Hindu sanctuary featuring colorful statues, dedicated to the Goddess Maya.
detail_description: The beautiful and sacred Hindu temple of Maya Devi is dedicated to the goddess who is believed to be an incarnation of Shakti. The temple is one of the holiest places in Haridwar, and devotees believe that all their prayers are answered here. There are colorful statues of the goddess throughout the temple, and it is also said to be a place where people's wishes come true.
name: Maya Devi Temple, Haridwar
address: Upper Rd, Birla Ghat, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

excerpt: Multicolored temple beside the River Ganges, featured in Hindu mythology & dedicated to Lord Shiva.
detail_description: Shree Daksheshwar Mahadev - Daksh Prajapati Temple is a vibrant and significant Hindu temple situated near the River Ganges. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva and holds historical importance related to the tale of King Daksha, Sati, and Lord Shiva.
name: Shree Daksheshwar Mahadev - Daksh Prajapati Temple
address: Daksheshwar Mahadev Temple, Kankhal, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249407, India

excerpt: Wildlife sanctuary with protected elephants & tigers,  jungle safaris & eco-tourism cottages.
detail_description: Rajaji National Park is a sprawling wildlife sanctuary located on the foothills of the picturesque Shiwalik ranges, covering over 820 square kilometers. It boasts a rich biodiversity with over 400 species of birds and the highest population of elephants. The park offers jungle safaris and eco-tourism cottages for visitors to immerse themselves in nature. While exploring, you may encounter various animals such as deer, peacocks, and colorful birds.
name: Rajaji National Park
address: Uttarakhand, India

detail_description: Vishnu Ghat is one of the significant Ghats in Haridwar, India. It is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is believed to be a holy place where he sanctified the river water by taking a bath. This Ghat holds historical and spiritual importance, serving as the starting point for pilgrims embarking on Chardham yatra. Known for its cleanliness and peaceful atmosphere, it attracts visitors seeking spiritual rejuvenation.
name: Vishnu Ghat
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Patanjali Yogpeeth, situated in Haridwar, India, is the largest yoga school in the country and a prominent center for yoga and Ayurveda. Founded by Baba Ram Dev in 2006, it serves as a clinical and research facility offering various services such as yoga classes, research camps, ayurvedic consultations, housing for the underprivileged, public transit access, library facilities, and education in medicinal plant cultivation.
name: Patanjali Yogpeeth
address: Maharshi Dayanand Gram Delhi-Haridwar, National Highway, near Bahadarbad, Uttarakhand 249405, India

detail_description: Gau Ghat is one of the significant ghats in Haridwar, located near Subhash Ghat. It is less crowded compared to other ghats and holds historical importance as it was the site for immersing the ashes of Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru, and Indira Gandhi. The ghat is commonly visited by those seeking forgiveness for cow slaughter and for performing pinddaan rituals to honor departed family members.
name: Gau Ghat
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Saptha Rishi Ashram Library & Community Hall is a serene and historic location in Haridwar, where it is said that seven revered sages meditated. These sages include Kashyapa, Vashisht, Atri, Vishwamitra, Jamadagni, Bharadwaja and Gautam. The library houses a collection of books in Sanskrit and Nagri script. The site's beauty adds to its allure as a place of cultural and historical significance.
name: Saptha Rishi Ashram Library & Community Hall
address: X5QV+4XH, Haripur Kalan, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249411, India

detail_description: Pawan Dham, situated just 2 km from Haridwar along the Rishikesh road, is a social welfare organization that offers various services such as Sant Seva, Cow Seva, and free food for saints. Additionally, it provides pilgrims with Dharamshala facilities in Haridwar. The ashram features a beautifully adorned temple with intricate mirror and glasswork, as well as elaborately decorated idols in a serene environment.
name: pawan dham
address: Haridwar, Bhagirathi Nagar, Bhoopatwala, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249411, India

excerpt: Prominent ashram with spiritual camps & classes, plus daily sacramental rites in a tranquil setting.
detail_description: Shantikunj Gayatri Parivar, also known as Gayatri Shakti Peeth, is a prominent ashram and the headquarters of All World Gayatri Pariwar. Established in 1971 by Pandit Shriram Sharma, it is located in a serene area on Rishikesh Road in Haridwar. The ashram offers spiritual camps, classes, and daily sacramental rites, attracting millions of followers worldwide.
name: Shantikunj Gayatri Parivar
address: Shantikunj, Shanti Kunj, Shantikunj Rd, Motichur, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

detail_description: Parad Shivling, located inside the Harihar Ashram in Kankhal, Haridwar, is a unique and famous Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. This Mercury Shivling weighs about 150 kg and was first worshipped during the Kumbh Mela in 1986. The name 'Parad Shivling' translates to 'Mercury Shivling.' It holds significance as it is believed to be where Shiva married Shakti.
name: Parad Shivling
address: Harihar Ashram Temple Complex, Mohallla Miaria, Mayapur, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249408, India

detail_description: Shanti Kunj Gayatri Teerth in Haridwar is the headquarters of All World Gayatri Pariwar and a renowned ashram. It serves as a spiritual and social awakening center, offering training based on divine spiritual concepts to revive Rishi traditions. Visitors can experience meditation, darshan, service, and accommodation all in one place. The serene atmosphere is filled with Hindu religious activities such as yagya hawan, prayers, and other cultural practices.
name: Shanti kunj Gayatri Teerth Haridwar
address: X5PQ+64M, Motichur, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

excerpt: Hindu spiritual center offering accommodation, religious instruction, meditation & ritual bathing.
detail_description: Saptrishi Ashram, located near Haridwar, is a serene and traditional Hindu spiritual center where accommodation, religious instruction, meditation, and ritual bathing are offered. The ashram is believed to be the place where seven great sages or Saptarishis meditated. Nestled by the riverbank, it is a popular site for both Hindu devotees seeking solace and visitors looking to find peace through meditation and yoga practices.
name: Saptrishi Ashram, Haridwar
address: Bhoopatwala, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249410, India

excerpt: Compact, remote temple dedicated to Lord Shiva & featuring smaller temples to other gods.
detail_description: Shri Bilvkeshwar Mahadev Temple Niranjani Akhada is a compact and remote temple located in the Bilva Parvat valley, within walking distance from Haridwar Railway Station. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, with smaller temples for other gods like Lord Ganesha and Lord Hanuman.
name: Shri Bilvkeshwar Mahadev Temple Niranjani Akhada
address: X534+F6W, Bypass Road, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: The city offers several significant religious sites, including the Jairam Ashram, Shanti Kunj, Doodhadari temple, Pawan Dham, Bharat Mata Mandir, Parmarth Ashram, and Radha Krishan temple. The Tourism Department of Uttarakhand provides excellent accommodation options for pilgrims. If unable to visit Vaishno Devi in Kashmir, one can visit its replica in Haridwar.
name: Vaishno Devi Temple (Mata Lal devi Ji)
address: X5JQ+RRF, Sapta Sarover Rd, Motichur, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

detail_description: Birla Ghat, located next to Vishnu Ghat, is one of the oldest and most revered sites in Haridwar. It offers a serene and peaceful atmosphere, often free from large crowds. Many visitors come here to take a purifying dip in the holy waters of River Ganga, as it is believed to cleanse sins. The ghat features security barriers near the stairs to ensure safety from the strong water currents.
name: Birla Ghat
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Swami Vivekanand Park, located near Har ki Pauri in Haridwar, is a mesmerizing triangular amusement park with lush green lawns and blooming flower beds. The park features a massive statue of Swami Vivekananda as its focal point and also boasts a prominent statue of Lord Shiva. This well-maintained park is ideal for day picnics, jogging, and moments of tranquility and reflection.
name: Swami Vivekanand Park
address: NH 58, Har Ki Pauri, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

excerpt: Hindu ashram dedicated to social welfare, with many statues including a popular one of Lord Shiva.
detail_description: Bhuma Niketan is a Hindu ashram and shrine located in Haridwar, dedicated to social welfare and adorned with intricate statues depicting Hindu mythological deities. Founded by Swami Shri Bhumananda Teerth Ji, the sanctuary is known for its lifelike sculptures of various gods and goddesses, with a popular statue of Lord Shiva at the entrance gates.
name: Bhuma Niketan
address: Saptsarover Road, Motichur, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249410, India

detail_description: Crystal World is the largest entertainment destination in Uttarakhand, offering a wide range of activities for visitors. From thrilling water rides to serene natural surroundings, Crystal World has something for everyone. Whether you're looking for an adrenaline rush or a peaceful retreat, this attraction has it all. With its diverse array of entertainment options, Crystal World is sure to provide a memorable experience for all who visit.
name: Crystal world
address: W4HF+C68, Purvi Nath Nagar, Arya Nagar, Jwalapur, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249407, India

detail_description: Mata Vaishno Devi Temple Har-Ki-Pauri is a replica of the famous Vaishno Devi shrine in Kashmir, featuring tunnels and caves leading to the inner sanctum where the idols of Goddess Vaishno Devi, Lakshmi, Kaali, and Saraswati are housed. This modern temple has gained popularity for its unique architecture and resemblance to the original shrine in Katra.
name: Mata Vaishno Devi Temple Har-Ki-Pauri
address: X549+GQW, Har Ki Pauri, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Sureshwari Devi Mandir, nestled on the outskirts of Haridwar in Ranipur, is a serene temple dedicated to Goddess Durga. Surrounded by the tranquil forest area of Rajaji National Park, it offers a peaceful and spiritual retreat for visitors seeking solace and connection with nature.
name: Sureshwari Devi Mandir
address: Ranipur Range, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Jai Ram Ashram, located in Bhimgoda, Haridwar, was established by Adi Guru Sri Jai Ram Maharaj in 1891 and has gained popularity for its services. The ashram is situated near the city center and offers well-maintained gardens with colorful fountains and blooming flowers. It provides accommodation near the Har ki Pauri and offers a serene atmosphere by the Ganga river.
name: Jai Ram Ashram
address: Shankar Rd, Satyam Vihar Colony, Bhagirathi Nagar, Motichur, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

excerpt: Lively Hindu place of worship featuring nightly ceremonies along the River Ganges.
detail_description: Ganga Aarti Sthal in Haridwar is a vibrant hub of spirituality and devotion, where the sacred Ganges River becomes the backdrop for an enchanting evening ritual. Each night at Har Ki Pauri ghat, priests lead a mesmerizing ceremony filled with light and sound, as they perform prayers using bowls of fire while temple bells resonate through the air. This captivating event draws both tourists and devotees from around the globe who gather to witness this beautiful spectacle.
name: Ganga Aarti Sthal, Haridwar
address: X54C+F87, Har Ki Pauri, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

excerpt:
Kankhal is a small colony in Haridwar in the Haridwar district of Uttarakhand state in India.
Mentioned in the Vayu Purana and the Mahabharata as Kanakhala, Kankhal is one of 'Panch Tirth' within Haridwar, with other spots being Gangadwara, Kushwart, Bilwa Teerth and Neel Parvat. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kankhal, a small colony in Haridwar, Uttarakhand, India, is steeped in history and spirituality. Referred to as Kanakhala in ancient texts like the Vayu Purana and the Mahabharata, Kankhal holds significance as one of the 'Panch Tirth' within Haridwar. This sacred place is part of a group that includes Gangadwara, Kushwart, Bilwa Teerth and Neel Parvat.
name: Kankhal
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand, India

detail_description: Nestled in the serene Haripur Kalan area of Haridwar, Adbhut Mandir is a stunning temple dedicated to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. Spanning an impressive 3 acres, this architectural marvel took 16 years to complete, with its construction beginning in 2000 and culminating in its inauguration in 2016. The temple's design harmoniously blends with the lush greenery and the gentle flow of a nearby river, creating a tranquil atmosphere that enchants visitors.
name: Adbhut Mandir
address: Unnamed Rd, Haripur Kalan, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249411, India

detail_description: Pawan Dham is a revered ancient temple located in Haridwar, just 4 km from the city center. Situated at Bhagirathi Nagar, Bhupatwala, this non-profit organization is a significant site for Hindu pilgrims. The temple's main attraction is the stunning idol of Lord Krishna imparting the teachings of the Bhagavad Geeta to Arjun. It holds a special place among visitors seeking spiritual experiences in Haridwar.
name: Pawan dham
address: 03, Bhagirathi Nagar, Bhoopatwala, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

excerpt: Busy pilgrimage spot known for ritual bathing & evening prayers with lights floating on the river.
detail_description: Har Ki Pauri, located on the banks of the River Ganges in Haridwar, is a significant pilgrimage spot and a major landmark of the holy city. Constructed in memory of King Vikramaditya's brother, it is believed to be where the sacred river emerges from the Himalayas. Pilgrims gather here for ritual bathing and evening prayers with floating lights on the river.
name: Har Ki Pauri, Haridwar
address: Shri Jairam Ashram No.1, Har Ki Pauri, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Maa Anandamayee Ashram, situated in Kankhal, Haridwar, is a serene and spiritual place dedicated to the renowned saint Sri Anandamoyi Ma. The ashram features the mausoleum of Ma Anandmayi and hosts twilight aarti and satsangs that are quite captivating for both the ashram residents and followers.
name: Maa Anandamayee Ashram
address: Shree Shree Maa Anandamayee Ashram, Brahm Vihar Colony, Kankhal, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249408, India

excerpt: Haridwar is an ancient city and important Hindu pilgrimage site in North India's Uttarakhand state, where the River Ganges exits the Himalayan foothills. The largest of several sacred ghats (bathing steps), Har Ki Pauri hosts a nightly Ganga Aarti (river-worshipping ceremony) in which tiny flickering lamps are floated off the steps. Worshipers fill the city during major festivals including the annual Kanwar Mela.
detail_description: Haridwar, located in Uttarakhand, North India, is an ancient city and a significant Hindu pilgrimage site where the River Ganges emerges from the Himalayan foothills. The city is known for its sacred ghats, with Har Ki Pauri being the largest and hosting a nightly Ganga Aarti ceremony. This event attracts worshippers and visitors alike. Haridwar is also famous for major festivals like the annual Kanwar Mela.
name: Haridwar
address: Uttarakhand, India

excerpt: Tranquil ashram complex featuring a spacious meditation hall & leafy gardens with a fountain.
detail_description: Nestled in the sacred city of Haridwar, Shri Prem Nagar Ashram is a serene oasis that invites visitors from around the globe to find solace and spiritual rejuvenation. Established in 1944 by Yogiraj Satgurudev Shri Hans Ji Maharaj, this tranquil ashram was brought to life through the dedication of his devoted followers. Set just 3 km from the bustling heart of Haridwar, it offers a peaceful retreat adorned with lush gardens and a soothing fountain.
name: Shri Prem Nagar Ashram, Haridwar
address: Jwalapur Rd, Prem Nagar, Haridwar, Jwalapur, Uttarakhand 249407, India

detail_description: Rishi Ashram, also known as Kanva Rishi Ashram, is a revered temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It was established by Kanva Rishi, a significant figure in Hindu mythology. The temple's architecture resembles a lotus flower and is adorned with intricate paintings, sculptures, and designs. This sacred site is believed to be an abode for divine saints and is exclusively meant for their residence and spiritual practices.
name: Rishi Ashram
address: X5JQ+V69, Bhoopatwala, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249410, India

detail_description: Pawan Dham, located in the serene city of Haridwar, is a tranquil ashram that serves as a Non-Profit Organization dedicated to the well-being of saints, cows, and other marginalized groups. The ashram provides complimentary accommodation and meals for both saints and visitors, along with various recreational amenities. It is an ideal retreat away from the bustling city life.
name: Pawan dham
address: 03, Bhagirathi Nagar, Bhoopatwala, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

detail_description: The Pentagon Mall, situated in the SIDCUL area of Haridwar, Uttarakhand, offers a contemporary experience in this sacred city. Spanning 7,50,000 square feet across five floors, it houses a diverse range of retail outlets including Indian and international clothing stores, boutiques, home decor and furniture shops, as well as electronic goods stores. Additionally, visitors can enjoy gaming zones and entertainment options suitable for families and friends.
name: The Pentagon Mall
address: Plot No:C1, BHEL Main Road, Sector 12, SIDCUL, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249403, India

detail_description: Kusha Ghat, also known as Kushavarta Ghat, is a renowned ghat in Haridwar, located just 1.5 km from Haridwar Junction Railway Station and 500m from Har Ki Pauri. It was built by the Maratha queen Ahilyabai Holkar and holds historical significance as it is linked to the revered ancient saint Dattatreya. This ghat is a popular spot for visitors due to its cultural and religious importance.
name: Kusha Ghat
address: Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: The Kumbh Mela is a spectacular and monumental event that occurs every twelve years, drawing millions of devotees to the sacred banks of Haridwar in Uttarakhand, India. This grand Hindu festival celebrates the legendary moment when drops of immortality nectar fell from a pitcher during a cosmic churning of the ocean. The historical roots of this gathering can be traced back to ancient times, with references found in accounts by Chinese traveler Xuanzang who visited India in 629 AD.
name: Kumbh Mela 2021
address: 393, More, Vikas Colony, Govindpuri, Ranipur, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Sati Kund Mandir, located in the Kankhal region, is a significant mythological site that commemorates the death of Sati, Lord Shiva's wife. According to Hindu traditions and scriptures like the Vayu Purana and Mahabharata, Sati Kund is where Sati immolated herself in response to her father Daksha Prajapati's disrespectful treatment of Lord Shiva. The site was originally a Yagna Kund, a sacrificial fire pit.
name: Sati Kund Mandir
address: Brahm Vihar Colony, Kankhal, W4FR PX9, Sarva Priya Vihar Colony, Jagjeetpur, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249404, India

excerpt: Straightforward metal irrigation & hydroelectric dam with wildlife & a sizable reservoir.
detail_description: Bhimgoda Barrage is a significant metal irrigation and hydroelectric dam that features a sizable reservoir. It is named after the kund of Bhimgoda, which was created when Bhima, one of the Pandava brothers, thrust his knees into a rock and water sprang out. The barrage is known for its wildlife sanctuary where migratory birds, including Siberian Cranes, can be spotted during winters.
name: Bhimgoda Barrage
address: X54J+G4Q, Bhimgoda barrage mod,, Rishikesh Rd, Birla Ghat, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Shri Santosh Puri Ashram, located 8 kilometers from Haridwar, offers guidance in education, transformation, and home. Situated along the Ganga River, it provides a serene atmosphere with the sound of bells and devotional songs from neighboring ashrams. The ashram emphasizes yoga as a tool for personal transformation. Visitors can also experience alternative healing practices such as Reiki, Pranic healing, acupressure, and Ayurvedic massage at nominal costs.
name: Shri Santosh Puri Ashram (YogAnga Retreat)
address: Haripur Kalan, Raiwala, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249205, India

detail_description: Shri Ramanand Ashram, situated in Shravan Nath Nagar near the railway station in Haridwar, holds significant importance in the Ramanand Sampraday. The ashram is currently led by Mahant Bhagwan Das and is known for its tranquil atmosphere. Shri Ramanand Swami, believed to be the incarnation of Uddavji, founded the Uddhav Sampradhay and was born into a Brahmin family.
name: Ramanand Ashram
address: W5W5+WH7, Sharvan Nath Nagar, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

excerpt: Historic Hindu temple accessible by cable car offering picturesque mountaintop views.
detail_description: Perched atop Neel Parvat in the holy city of Haridwar, Uttarakhand, India, the Chandi Devi Temple is a Hindu shrine dedicated to Chandika Devi. Legend has it that she was created from the energy of Devi Durga to vanquish the demon kings Shumbha and Nishumbha. The temple offers serene surroundings for contemplation and spiritual solace, although visitors should be cautious of mischievous monkeys.
name: Shri Maa Chandi Devi Temple, Haridwar
address: W5MJ+G63, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249408, India

detail_description: Har ki Pauri ghat, located on the banks of the sacred River Ganges, is revered by worshippers as a manifestation of Goddess Ganga. The act of bathing in the Bramhakund at this ghat is believed to have purifying effects, washing away one's sins according to local beliefs. It holds great spiritual significance and draws devotees seeking spiritual cleansing and blessings from the holy waters.
name: Har Ki Pauri - Maa Ganga Ghat
address: X539+CH, Rd, Har Ki Pauri, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Gayatri Tirth Shantikunj in Haridwar is a renowned spiritual and moral enlightenment center, serving as the headquarters of All World Gayatri Pariwar (AWGP) since 1971. It attracts millions of followers globally and focuses on promoting national integration, cultural values, and ethical principles alongside spiritual upliftment. Visitors praise the peaceful atmosphere and the opportunity for meditation, emphasizing the positive vibes and transformative experiences. The ashram offers free accommodation and food, making it accessible to all.
name: Gayatritirth Shantikunj Haridwar
address: Near, Shantikunj Rd, Bhooputwala, Motichur, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249401, India

detail_description: Uttarakhand Adventures in Haridwar offers an exciting way to explore the hilly terrain by renting a bike or cycle. While biking within the town is eco-friendly and cost-effective, guided tours are recommended for venturing into remote areas. A popular destination is the nearby Gurjar Tribe Village, where visitors can engage with the tribal community and even share a meal with them.
name: Uttarakhand Adventures haridwar
address: near BSNL office, ISBT, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India

excerpt: Replica of the Vaishno Devi Temple in Jammu & Kashmir, with caves & tunnels leading to the shrine.
detail_description: Nestled just 7.3 km from Haridwar, the Vaishno Devi Temple is a captivating replica of the revered shrine in Jammu & Kashmir. This enchanting temple features intricate tunnels and caves that guide visitors to the inner sanctum where the divine presence of Goddess Vaishno Devi resides alongside idols of Goddesses Lakshmi, Kali, and Saraswati.
name: Vaishno Devi
address: W4J9+6RJ, Jagdish Nagar, Jwalapur, Uttarakhand 249407, India

excerpt: Bustling amusement park with rides for younger & older kids, water slides, boating & video games.
name: Crystal World
address: Delhi Rd, Batedi, Haridwar, Badheri Rajputan, Uttarakhand 249405, India

excerpt: Wildlife sanctuary with protected elephants & tigers,  jungle safaris & eco-tourism cottages.
detail_description: The Rajaji Tiger Reserve is a famous wildlife reserve in Uttarakhand, India. It is home to a variety of animals including elephants, wild boar, deers, stags, leopard and nature. Although it is not the best place to see tigers (as they are relatively rare), the park is still a great place to visit if you love safaris.
name: Rajaji National Park
address: Uttarakhand, India

detail_description: Raja Birla Tower, a stunning architectural gem located in the heart of Haridwar, is an iconic landmark that captures the essence of this sacred city. Erected in 1938 by Shri Raja Dr Baldev Das Birla, this impressive clock tower features intricate carvings and stands tall with a clock on each side displaying Roman numerals. Visitors can ascend to enjoy breathtaking views of the Ganges River as it gracefully flows through Haridwar, creating a serene backdrop for spiritual reflection.
name: Raja Birla Tower
address: X53C+HF8, Rodi Belwala, Haridwar, Uttarakhand 249401, India
